intro: Modesciadium involucratum, commonly known as the velvetleaf mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy, pale pink to lavender flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in warm climates. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton. Its structure includes a stout stem with opposite leaves and a distinctive calyx that persists after flowering.
